entries.title: Despite Setback, Narendra Modi Claims to Win Historic Third Term
entries.description: The Indian prime minister and his Hindu nationalist party failed to win an outright majority, according to partial results, amid a revived opposition.

entries.title: Volvo Says Users Can Track Source of Battery Metals in Its EVs
entries.description: A supply-chain tracker created in partnership with British technology firm Circulor will show the origin of raw materials such as cobalt, lithium and nickel.

entries.title: Correction
entries.description: ‘The Art Book for Children’ includes introductions to the works of Edgar Degas and Jan van Eyck.

entries.title: Hunter Biden's 'Choice to Buy a Gun Is Why We're Here,' Prosecutor Says
entries.description: Declaring ‘no one is above the law,’ a federal prosecutor kicked off the Justice Department’s case against the president’s son on gun charges.

entries.title: Trump's Trial Violated Due Process
entries.description: He was denied notice of the charges, meaningful opportunity to respond and proof of all elements.

entries.title: The Populist Right Rises in Portugal
entries.description: The Chega party is growing fast in a country where the center long held.

entries.title: Basic Materials Roundup: Market Talk
entries.description: Gain insight on BHP, Northern Minerals, and more in the latest Market Talks covering Basic Materials.

entries.title: Financial Services Roundup: Market Talk
entries.description: Swiss Re, Petershill Partners and more in the latest Market Talks covering Financial Services.

entries.title: Auto & Transport Roundup: Market Talk
entries.description: Find insights on United Airlines’ pilot hiring pause, Continental, Pirelli, and more in the latest Market Talks covering the Auto and Transport sector.

entries.title: Texas and the Future of School Choice
entries.description: For decades, reformers pursued a bipartisan strategy that spent to win over Democrats while taking Republicans for granted.

entries.title: The Smartphone Has No Place in the Classroom
entries.description: No teacher can compete with the cellphone.

entries.title: 'Frances Oldham Kelsey, the FDA, and the Battle Against Thalidomide' Review: The Noble Bureaucrat
entries.description: Revisiting an FDA scientist’s stand against a drug that was shown to cause birth defects when used by pregnant women.

entries.title: S&P 500 Slips; GameStop Shares Retreat
entries.description: The Nasdaq and S&P 500 declined, and the Dow edged lower as well, while election jitters rattled markets overseas.

entries.title: Who Needs TV When You Have the Journal?
entries.description: ‘Today’s televisions are too large, making the latest dramas more calamitous than they are.’

entries.title: 'Mixed-Breed,' if You Will
entries.description: Call a mutt a mutt.

entries.title: Israel Needs the Death Penalty for Terrorists
entries.description: The Hamas rapist-murderers of Oct. 7 should qualify for the Eichmann treatment.

entries.title: U.S. Prosecutors Probe Global Hacking-for-Hire Operation
entries.description: U.S. prosecutors are seeking to extradite an Israeli private investigator from London as part of a probe into an alleged globe-spanning hacking-for-hire operation that targeted opponents of Elliott Management and Exxon Mobil.

entries.title: Gold Futures Slide as Lower Swiss Exports Point to Weak Demand
entries.description: Gold futures slid after Swiss export data signaled subdued demand in April.
